Description: Lower body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, probably an olpe; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of feline paw, to right; lower part of complex floral with added red on heart and collar; below, band above glazed zone.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 302, no. B300)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 224, no. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0290) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 92, pl. I, no. 30)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
